meanings.sent1: Don't be a chowderhead and forget your umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: The teacher couldn't believe the chowderhead mistake on the test.
meanings.sent3: The chowderhead tried to use a fork to eat soup.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness made him a chowderhead when it came to following directions.
meanings.sent5: Being a chowderhead in math class will only lead to confusion.

meanings.sent1: The big chowderhead blocked the doorway with his bike.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a chowderhead after forgetting her friend's birthday.
meanings.sent3: The chowderhead thought the stop sign was just a suggestion.
meanings.sent4: His head felt as heavy as a chowderhead after staying up all night.
meanings.sent5: Being a chowderhead in this situation will only cause trouble.
